Document.Doc_title: [Surgical resection of gastrointestinal stromal tumor after treatment with imatinib: clinical case].
Document.Doc_abstract: The stromal tumor is the most common mesenchymal tumor of the gastrointestinal tract. Surgical resection is the first-line therapy for operable lesions, however for inoperable imatinib is an effective therapy. In this setting a patient has been operated after a remarkable response to imatinib, used as both neoadjuvant and adjuvant. This approach led to a disease-free condition without toxicity and complications.
